intro: Boottia heterophylla, commonly known as the variable leaf boottia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream banks. Its leaves are highly variable in shape and size, which is a notable botanical feature. Boottia heterophylla produces small, white to greenish flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the Apiaceae family.
